channel.title: Github - Today I Learnt â€” David Winterbottom

item.title: Github supports a Markdown extension for creating alert blocks
item.description: The syntax is: > [!NOTE] > This is a note.

item.title: That two trailing spaces indicates a line break in Markdown
item.description: Not sure how I’ve never come across this before, but Markdown supports hard line breaks by ending a line with two spaces.

item.title: That Vimium has shortcuts for following pagination links
item.description: Until today, I had Vimium disabled for Github as I believed Github’s keyboard shortcuts were useful enough to warrant losing Vimium’s.

item.title: That `hub` clashes with `vim-polyglot`
item.description: I use Github’s hub library to create pull requests with a command similar to:

item.title: About `pycon` markdown format
item.description: Github-flavoured markdown uses Linguist for syntax highlighting, and Linguist supports “Python console” as a language.

item.title: About Github's `involves:$username` search filter
item.description: There’s a plethora of filters that can be used with Github’s search functionality.

item.title: About Github's `@me` search term
item.description: Which lets you filter by the current user. For example, use is:open is:pr author:@me to show pull-requests authored by yourself:

item.title: How to embed markdown content in a Github code block
item.description: Normally, fenced code blocks are delimited with triple backticks ```.
